channel.description: Twitter feed for: @archaeococo. Generated by nitter.42l.fr

item.title: RT by @archaeococo: ‘I think of the word “keening” and how too much is left to go or be stolen quietly.’ Dear god, @porridgebrain is astonishing. Read her here 👇 Reaching out to the starlings on the wire https://www.theguardian.com/environment/2022/jun/27/country-diary-reaching-out-to-the-starlings-on-the-wire?CMP=share_btn_tw

item.title: RT by @archaeococo: With the ongoing discussion about how non-fiction by men tops the charts I want to promote NF writing by women in my upcoming newsletters this summer (sort of alternative summer reading list). Pls do add here one of yours and/or other books published (or to-be) in 2022. Thanks!
item.dc:creator: @DrPragyaAgarwal
item.description: With the ongoing discussion about how non-fiction by men tops the charts I want to promote NF writing by women in my upcoming newsletters this summer (sort of alternative summer reading list). Pls do add here one of yours and/or other books published (or to-be) in 2022. Thanks!

item.title: RT by @archaeococo: When was it ever more important in our history for young people to be able to manipulate language and to understand how they are manipulated by language and stories.
item.dc:creator: @maryvpeace
item.description: When was it ever more important in our history for young people to be able to manipulate language and to understand how they are manipulated by language and stories.

item.title: R to @AmyJaneBeer: Oh Amy how utterly stunning 💚💚 what a gift!
item.dc:creator: @archaeococo
item.description: Oh Amy how utterly stunning 💚💚 what a gift!

item.title: RT by @archaeococo: Thanks so much all who listened 💚 Talking to the amazing women in the programme, @SorrelLyall, @leecraigie_, Ali and Catriona, truly touched me. So inspirational! And thank you @flowerpot for bringing us together. You can listen on BBC Sounds here 👉🏻 https://www.bbc.co.uk/programmes/m00180d0
item.dc:creator: @Lucy_Lapwing
item.description: Thanks so much all who listened 💚 Talking to the amazing women in the programme, @SorrelLyall, @leecraigie_, Ali and Catriona, truly touched me. So inspirational! And thank you @flowerpot for bringing us together. You can listen on BBC Sounds here 👉🏻 bbc.co.uk/programmes/m00180d…

item.dc:creator: @inkcapjournal
item.description:
One week since we launched our immersive feature, Six Thousand Years of Forests, and it's already our most popular piece EVER.

If you haven't seen it yet, you can read it here. Best on a big screen, with headphones. 🎧

@JosephMonkhouse @AdamCormack_
inkcapjournal.co.uk/six-thou…

item.title:
RT by @archaeococo: "I criticise these kinds of ‘nature cures’ – the commodified, the depoliticised, the insipid – because I don’t believe they’ll solve anyone’s problems."
it's me, problematising nature cures *again*, on the brilliant Wellcome Stories 🐸
item.dc:creator: @samlwalton
item.description:
"I criticise these kinds of ‘nature cures’ – the commodified, the depoliticised, the insipid – because I don’t believe they’ll solve anyone’s problems."

it's me, problematising nature cures *again*, on the brilliant Wellcome Stories 🐸

item.title: RT by @archaeococo: the right to roam is about more than recreation. The English countryside is a place to find joy and wonder, to come together with friends, to heal ourselves. The right to roam is the right to belong. For everyone... Please watch our new video and share...
item.dc:creator: @nickhayesillus1
item.description: the right to roam is about more than recreation. The English countryside is a place to find joy and wonder, to come together with friends, to heal ourselves. The right to roam is the right to belong. For everyone... Please watch our new video and share...

item.title:
RT by @archaeococo: 'This is a book of the seen and unseen; on being alive; on being wild; on being a woman'.
'A Line Above the Sky' — @HelenMort's story of mountains and motherhood — is published today by @EburyPublishing. @kerri_ni reviews https://bit.ly/3Lbyyu3
item.dc:creator: @tweetbytheriver
item.description:
'This is a book of the seen and unseen; on being alive; on being wild; on being a woman'.

'A Line Above the Sky' — @HelenMort's story of mountains and motherhood — is published today by @EburyPublishing. @kerri_ni reviews bit.ly/3Lbyyu3

item.title: RT by @archaeococo: 📢Just announced! @TheFellingFilm will be screening at @showroomcinema #Sheffield from 1st to 7th April 2022. Please RT and book early! #SaveSheffTrees https://www.fellingfilm.com/ 🌳🌳🌳

item.title:
RT by @archaeococo: Sunshine at Bedtime is one of the poems in Out and About.
It includes the most memorable of lines: Sunshine at bedtime, Why isn’t it dark?
item.dc:creator: @ShirleyHughes_
item.description:
Sunshine at Bedtime is one of the poems in Out and About.

It includes the most memorable of lines:
Sunshine at bedtime,
Why isn’t it dark?

item.title: RT by @archaeococo: 1. Just finished @tanyashadrick ‘s ‘The Cure for Sleep’. I need to talk about it straight away. I need to recommend it to my creative women friends, who walk in the liminal places between class, friends who are walking in the strange spaces of motherhood and self belief.
item.dc:creator: @wondykitten
item.description: 1. Just finished @tanyashadrick ‘s ‘The Cure for Sleep’. I need to talk about it straight away. I need to recommend it to my creative women friends, who walk in the liminal places between class, friends who are walking in the strange spaces of motherhood and self belief.

item.title: RT by @archaeococo: The first time I met @archaeococo (thanks to @RobGMacfarlane) we ended up in a cave, in pitch darkness, totally unexpectedly, and bonded over river lore and a bit of rock-sniffing. Good to go back to our roots today @CreswellCrags 1/3
item.dc:creator: @AmyJaneBeer
item.description: The first time I met @archaeococo (thanks to @RobGMacfarlane) we ended up in a cave, in pitch darkness, totally unexpectedly, and bonded over river lore and a bit of rock-sniffing. Good to go back to our roots today @CreswellCrags 1/3

item.title:
RT by @archaeococo: We're really excited to be opening a call for papers for our first symposium, happening later this year! Talking Place aims to provide a platform for discussion and conversation around creative practice rooted in place.
https://womentalkplace.com/2022/01/25/talking-place-a-symposium/
item.dc:creator: @womentalkplace
item.description:
We're really excited to be opening a call for papers for our first symposium, happening later this year! Talking Place aims to provide a platform for discussion and conversation around creative practice rooted in place.

womentalkplace.com/2022/01/2…

item.title:
RT by @archaeococo: Thank you for writing this. A powerful and emotional read.
It is not all men, but men are part of the system, the structure that upholds misogyny, the way sexist behaviours are allowed to continue and excused, jokes and remarks ignored, banter normalised. All of it.
item.dc:creator: @DrPragyaAgarwal
item.description:
Thank you for writing this. A powerful and emotional read.

It is not all men, but men are part of the system, the structure that upholds misogyny, the way sexist behaviours are allowed to continue and excused, jokes and remarks ignored, banter normalised. All of it.

nitter.42l.fr/fergusfinlay/status/1483353676957859843#m

item.title: RT by @archaeococo: Hey, Twitter! I'd love for you to tell me about your favourite novels that incorporate some kind of magic or other-worldly enchantment but that did so in ways that are unusual or that felt out of the ordinary. What magic/magic-realism books have you read that felt surprising?
item.dc:creator: @porridgebrain
item.description: Hey, Twitter! I'd love for you to tell me about your favourite novels that incorporate some kind of magic or other-worldly enchantment but that did so in ways that are unusual or that felt out of the ordinary. What magic/magic-realism books have you read that felt surprising?

item.title:
RT by @archaeococo: The history/ethics/politics of non-western travel writing is my dream course to teach for a long time. Here's a short🧵on 10 books that flip the myth of traveling as a white colonial pastime:
1/ A collection of 45 Muslim women traveler's writings from the 17th-20th centuries
item.dc:creator: @samlra__
item.description:
The history/ethics/politics of non-western travel writing is my dream course to teach for a long time. Here's a short🧵on 10 books that flip the myth of traveling as a white colonial pastime:

1/ A collection of 45 Muslim women traveler's writings from the 17th-20th centuries

item.title:
RT by @archaeococo: This - magically - is where stories come in. For those of us who may not directly experience one or more forms of structural injustice, stories can provide an insight into lives of those who do.
To humbly, compassionately learn stories of others is a keystone of ethical living.
item.dc:creator: @ProfSunnySingh
item.description:
This - magically - is where stories come in. For those of us who may not directly experience one or more forms of structural injustice, stories can provide an insight into lives of those who do.

To humbly, compassionately learn stories of others is a keystone of ethical living.
